comment: Class is straightforward and simple. Notes and practice problems with answer keys are provided online. You can do well in the class with only the notes and practice online. Open to questions and doesn't judge. Allows notecards and cheat sheets on every test. Quizzes have strange due dates so pay attention. Decent amount of ALEKS homework (tedious).
Great Stats professor. Makes it very easy to pass the class and get a high grade. Aleks is used for homework but not difficult. Take her!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Great professor. Love her lectures. She does move fast but was very open to questions. We always finished our 1.25 hr class in at most 45 min. She allows notecards on all exams and quizzes.Finished notes and lecture videos are posted. Only problem was that quizzes were due at really sporadic times, so i missed a couple. but she drops lowest quiz.

was able to exempt my final exam even though i am not great at math. her lectures are easy to understand and she posts completed notes. homework is on ALEKS and quizzes are at home with three in person exams. if you put forth the effort, this is an amazing stats class to take. very friendly and opened up all quizzes at the end if you missed one.

She is committed to supporting her students and is very understanding. She reopened all assignments towards the end of the semester to make up any missed work. Attendance is not mandatory, show up to class if you want to pass.

Rather straightforward, all classes are lecture-based, occasional online homework and quizzes, tests are in-person (cheat-sheet notecards allowed). I would only take this professor if you already have a comfortable understanding of stats, there is not a lot of built-in support otherwise. Seems young and inexperienced, has room to grow her approach.
